page.title: 03Places of interest cont.
page.content: There is an interesting walk up a hill near the town centre, called The Mote.It is a small isolated hill thought to be glacial in origin and was the base of an early 13th cen tury fortification. On the top of the Mote is a statue of the 7th Earl of Carlisle and there are excellent views of Brampton. In the north-east of the area surveyed is Lanercost Priory. Parts of this Augustinian Priory founded in 1169 are well preserved. Some of the stones from Hadrian's Wall were used in its constuction. It was destroyed at least three times by the Scots. The most famous historic building in the area is Naworth Castle. It was the stronghold of the Dacre family in 1335 and converted to a mansion by the Howard family in the 17th century.
